metadata.title: CVE-2023-23559 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In rndis_query_oid in drivers/net/wireless/rndis_wlan.c in the Linux kernelthrough 6.1.5, there is an integer overflow in an addition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-generic - 4.4.0-237.271
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-237-lowlatency - 4.4.0-237.271
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1117-kvm - 4.4.0-1117.127
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1154-aws - 4.4.0-1154.169
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-aws - 4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-gcp - 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1116-oracle - 4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-237.271').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.127').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1154.169').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
